title: Unit 3 Sec 3: Communication & Coordination
description: Tests knowledge of the Nervous System, Special Senses, and Endocrine disorders.

questions.question: Arrange the steps of a Grand Mal (Tonic-Clonic) seizure in chronological order:
questions.explanation: Seizures typically start with an Aura, follow with stiffness (Tonic), then jerking (Clonic), and end with recovery (Post-ictal).

questions.question: A patient opens eyes to speech (3), gives confused responses (4), and localizes pain (5). What is the total Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) score?
Match the endocrine disorder to its cause:
questions.explanation: Cushing's = Excess steroid; Addison's = Lack of steroid; DI = Lack of Anti-Diuretic Hormone; Graves = Thyroid overactivity.

questions.question: The hormone responsible for lowering blood glucose levels by promoting cellular uptake is ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Insulin is secreted by the beta cells of the pancreas to lower blood sugar.

questions.question: Which of the following is a symptom of increased Intracranial Pressure (ICP)?
questions.explanation: Projectile vomiting and papilloedema are classic signs. Cushing's triad involves Bradycardia (not Tachycardia) and Hypertension (not Hypotension).
